analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Sabbaṁ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṁ aparijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ avirājayaṁ appajahaṁ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave an abhijānam a parijānam tattha cittam a virājayam a pajaham abhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “Monks, without directly knowing and fully understanding all, without making it fade away and letting go of it, one is not able to make an end of suffering.

original: Sabbañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
analyzed: sabbañca kho bhikkhave abhijānam parijānam tattha cittam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: But by directly knowing and fully understanding all, by making it fade away and letting go of it, one is able to make an end of suffering.”
And in connection with this, it was said:
he is not tied to any of the all.

original: sabbadukkhamupaccagā”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: sabba dukkham upaccagāti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: and has gone beyond all suffering.”

This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was with reference to this that it was said by the Blessed One: “The ending of all is the way to the Beyond.”🔽The seventh section on the ending of all is finished.
